13. Remove plate. Air dry. Wrap in Saran Wrap and put down for
autoradiography (overnight).
14. Cut out the substrate and. product. spots from. the TLC plate, using the
autoradiograph as aa reference, and determine the percent acetylation of
chloramphenicol by scintillation counting.
15. Determine the corresponding CAT enzyme activity in the injected embryos by
reference to the standard curve obtained for the bacterial CAT enzyme
preparation (1 unit of activity 2.614 1011 CAT enzyme molecules).
Reagents
1. 250 mM Tris (pH 7.8)
2. Acetyl coenzyme A (Sigma)
3. E. coli chloramphenicol acetyl transferase - 1000 ul/ml (Pharmacia).
Diiute 1000x. use 0.5, 1.0, 2.0, 4.0, and 8.0 10'3 units as standards.
4. ethyl acetate
5. methanol, chloroform
6. ['4c1 chloramphenicol (Amersham)
